casebody.data:
Charles W. GALVIN and Irwin Bloom, Plaintiff in Error, v. UNITED STATES, Defendant in Error. (Circuit Court of Appeals, Second Circuit. January 21, 1927.) No. 245. Simon S. Hamburger, of New York City, for plaintiff in error Galvin. Melvin H. Dalberg, of New York City, for plaintiff in error Bloom. Emory R. Buckner, U. S. Atty., of New York City (David P. Siegel'and Raphael P. Koenig, Asst. U. S. Attys., both of New York City, of counsel), for the United States.

Before MANTON and LEARNED HAND, Circuit Judges, and AUGUSTUS N. HAND, District Judge;

PER CURIAM.

Judgment of conviction affirmed.
